channel.title: Can you do this?
channel.description: When you are making a command method underneath [code] customCommand [/code] I was wondering if you could do this for the integer. [code] if (command.startsWith("modset") && playerRights == 1 && playerRights == 3) { [/code] Or would I have to do [code] if (command.startsWith("modset") && playerRights == 1) || (playerRights == 3) { [/code] Or would that be wrong too? I am not sure if you can do it, but if you can, I want to know how. Any info on how to do it? I am trying to make it so that when you type in ::modset on the server, moderators and owners can do it, but admins and non-staff cannot.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 21, 2009, 11:23:53 am[/size][hr]Does anyone know if you can do this?

item.title: Can you do this?
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

Yeah I want it so that when someone does

::modset

Only people with playerRights of 3 or 1 will receive the set.
And you can actually make it

if (command.startsWith("modset") && playerRights > 0) {

The equals sign is not needed. =P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 21, 2009, 01:20:26 pm[/size][hr]Problem Solved…

Read full topic

item.title: Can you do this?
item.dc:creator: @antcolony3 antcolony3
item.description:
@antcolony3 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("modset") && playerRights == 1 or playerRights == 3)) {

you don’t want to let them if they are admin???
so only mods and co-owners?
if u want mods, admins, and co-owners

if (command.startsWith("modset") && playerRights >= 1)

i hope that helpz =D

Read full topic

item.title: Can you do this?
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

When you are making a command method underneath

customCommand

I was wondering if you could do this for the integer.

if (command.startsWith("modset") && playerRights == 1 && playerRights == 3) {

Or would I have to do

if (command.startsWith("modset") && playerRights == 1) || (playerRights == 3) {

Or would that be wrong too? I am not sure if you can do it, but if you can, I want to know how. Any info on how to do it?
I am trying to make it so that when you type in ::modset on the server, moderators and owners can do it, but admins and non-staff cannot.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 21, 2009, 11:23:53 am[/size][hr]Does anyone know if you can do this?
